name: Hikeventure
intro: As a school assignment, a hiking app "Hikeventure" was designed. In addition, a landing page was also created for the promotion of the app (desktop only). Hikeventure is a walking app with a wide range of walking routes all over the world. They provide walking routes for both novice walkers to passionate ones.
part1: The app was only designed in Adobe Xd. First and foremost, a brainstorming session was held concerning the target group and which functionalities will be offered. The app was then presented visually using low-fidelity wireframes. After the feedback, these low-fidelity wireframes were converted to high-fidelity wireframes. Finally, a prototype with interactions was created.

name: MovieWorld
intro: As a school assignment, a movie application was created where users can review movies and series. In addition, they can also see the details of the movies and series, including the user rating. MovieWorld is based on the cinema feeling you get when watching a movie. The website is hosted on firebase.
part1: First of all, a brainstorming session was held about what the movie application should look like and what functionalities it should contain. Once this information was collected, low-fidelity and high-fidelity wireframes were created for the main web pages. After the feedback on this, MovieWorld was created with react.

name: Timeless Taste
intro: As a school assignment, the webshop "Timeless Taste" was created. The target group and products were free to choose from. We decided to offer watches and accompanying accessories. The target group are entrepreneurs, lawyers, business people, ... . A more luxurious feel was therefore chosen. This project was in collaboration with Jamie-Lee Hart.
part1: The first step in developing the webshop consisted of brainstorming about product ideas. We then used an idea board to map out the impulsive ideas. Subsequently, a mood board was chosen to make a schematic selection of the various ideas. The second step involved designing a Styletile in which the visual elements of the webshop were determined. Thirdly, the structure of the web store was built up by using a sitemap. The ideas were then converted to wireframes to get a first impression of the webshop. With subsequent detailed elaboration by the visual design. Finally, the result was programmed.

name: Roadbase
intro: RoadBase is a project created in a collaboration between Open Summer of Code and Agentschap Binnenlands Bestuur, Agentschap Wegen en Verkeer and Departement Mobiliteit en Openbare Werken Vlaanderen. The aim of this project is to create a tool to gather and integrate up to date information from different sources regarding road signs and road marks so that citizens, road managers and policy makers can effectively contribute to make their communities safer. Through linked open data, this tool is expected to provide convenience to road users and encourage them to actively engage in providing information to enhance road safety.
part1: RoadBase has been created by a team of nine multidisciplinary students with different backgrounds and a lot  of  dedication. Due to the global pandemic, virtual meetings are the main channel of communication and diverse digital tools (e.g. Figma, Trello, Notion, Ember) are deployed daily. Together with the coaches and student coaches, the team strives to provide the partners with the most concrete and valuable solution so that the organisations, citizens and all involved parties can truly benefit. To increase efficiency and flexibility, the team is divided into 2 subteams: the strategic team and the technical team.

name: Sybeja
intro: As a school assignment, a responsive website for an fictional digital agency (Sybeja) was designed. The website contains an overview of the services you provide, the successful cases, team members en contact information. This project was in collaboration with Jamie-Lee Hart
part1: This was a sprint assignment of 1 week. First and foremost, a brainstorming session was held concerning what type of digital agency we are and which functionalities will be offered. The website was then presented visually using low-fidelity wireframes. Finally, the low fidelity wireframes were converted into a working website.

name: Gentse Feesten
intro: The website for the "Gentse Feesten" was created as one of the first school assignments. This website contains a home page, day overview and event detail pages.
part1: Due to Covid-19, the "Gentse Feesten" 2020 edition was cancelled, but Thinline had already made the visual design for it. Our assignment was to convert this visual design into a real website with some personal touches.

name: Dormdash
intro: For the course Programming-5, Jamie-Lee Hart and I were asked to make a management application in collaboration with students from Canada. We have chosen to create a delivery application for students.
part1: Dormdash is a delivery application aimed at students. This app allows the students to order inexpensive and healthy meals from various restaurants nearby. In addition, Dormdash ensures that the dishes are delivered in an environmentally conscious way. The application also includes a dashboard for both the restaurants and the deliverers. This allows the restaurants to see statistics about the turnover. In addition, the restaurants can manage their dishes in the menu.

name: Diorama
intro: For the interactive media course I designed and programmed a three-dimensional diorama. The theme of the scene was Halloween.
part1: First of all, the scene was designed and the necessary 3D assets modeled in Blender. Then the diorama was programmed with React, Three.js and React Three Fiber.

name: Stock and reservation management
intro: Aiden Soufi and I were allowed to create a web application for the artevelde university of applied sciences to manage and reserve their IT equipment. This gives Artevelde more insights into the amount of IT material they have and where it is located at any time.
part1: Aiden was responsible for the design and creation of the client part of the web application. I was responsible for the full back-end and the admin dashboard. The SCRUM method was applied in this project.
